prepareApplication.question: Preparing your CV
answer:
We want to hear about what you've achieved, your strengths and skills.

We also want to know how they’ll help you in the job you're applying for.
☝️ And a tip - when talking about your past jobs focus on what you achieved, not your duties.

prepareApplication.question: If you need a CS degree
answer:
You don't need a computer science degree to be an engineer at Habito.

We're more interested in what you can do now.

prepareApplication.question: Reapplying for the same job
answer: If you weren't successful you can always reapply for a job.

But so you know, we'll look to see how you've addressed the reason you didn't get the job before.

It's normal for this to take time - maybe 6 to 12 months.

afterApply.question: What happens after I apply?
answer: If you look like a good fit for the job, we'll get in touch to arrange a call to discuss the job and your application.
After this we normally arrange a time for you to come in to our office for an interview.  We'll give you all the specific details based on the job you applied for.

afterApply.question: Do you keep applications for future jobs?
answer: We keep your details for 6 months and will let you know if a job comes up for you during that time.
To make sure we respect your personal data and comply with data regulations, we delete all your data after 6 months.
So if it’s been 6 months or more since you last applied you’ll need to send us a new one.

afterApply.question: How to prepare for interviews?
answer: In interviews we want to get to know you.  Your previous positions and challenges.  And what you're looking for in a career.
So it's a good idea to have some examples of different challenges you've faced.  And be able to explain what action you took.  And how it all turned out.
It's also good to check out ${ company.name } beforehand and get to know us and our industry.  And we'll have copies of your CV or portfolio - so no need to bring them.

afterApply.question: What to wear to an interview?
answer:
What you have to say is important to us - not what you're wearing.

So wear whatever makes you comfortable and confident!

workingOptions.question: Flexible working options
answer: We work hard to make our office a hive of activity and collaboration.  So we prefer you work there.
But if you need to work different hours, part-time or remotely, it’s best to mention this to the recruitment team when they contact you.  We'll do our best to accommodate you.

workingOptions.question: Leave benefits
answer:
We have a flexible holiday policy, so you can take your holiday in whatever way works for you.

We encourage everyone to take a minimum of 20 days a year, plus the 8 bank holidays.
We also offer enhanced maternity and paternity leave so you can spend more time with your new family.

workingOptions.question: International workers
answer: Habito is a registered sponsor - so we're happy to offer visa support where we can.  But due to Home Office restrictions, we can't sponsor all roles.

workingOptions.question: Students
answer: We have a number of internships during the year.  You can find these on our career site.
